intro: Tetranthera rangoonensis var. assamica, commonly known as the Assam tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, glandular stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both ecological studies and horticultural research.
